topic: Movie Workflow Series ("Sherlock Holmes explorative search")

goals.1: Identify the BGP for canon of Sherlock Holmes (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canon_of_Sherlock_Holmes)
goals.3: Identify the BGP for television series
goals.4: Return the year of publication (take the first one if there are more publication dates) for each film and television series related to the canon of Sherlock Holmes (the result set must be a list of triples film/tv series IRI, label and year).
goals.5: Find who acted in more than one film or tv series related to the canon of Sherlock Holmes (the result set must be a list of triples actor/actress IRI, label and #film).
goals.6: Identify the BGP for Primetime Emmy Award
goals.7: Return all the types of Primetime Emmy Award (the result set must be a list of couples award IRI and label).
goals.8: For each film and television series related to the canon of Sherlock Holmes, return the number of Primetime Emmy Awards they won (return also the objects who did not win an Award) (the result set must be a list of triples film/tv series IRI, label and #award).

name: f79a19311a

1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q35610 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20
output: Internet Speculative Fiction Database author ID

1.narrative: incoming edges to Arthur Conan Doyle
1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { ?sub ?p wd:Q35610 . ?p sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 200

1.narrative:
subjects with properties "creator","field of work", "characters" or "main subject" and object Arthur Conan Doyle.
increased the limit to 30
1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?subName ?name WHERE { ?sub ?p wd:Q35610 . ?p sc:name ?name. ?sub sc:name ?subName VALUES ?p {wdt:P170 wdt:P101 wdt:P674 wdt:P921} } LIMIT 30

1.narrative: basically the same query as before with limit up to 100
1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?sub ?subName WHERE { ?sub ?p wd:Q35610 . ?sub sc:name ?subName. VALUES ?p {wdt:P170 wdt:P101 wdt:P674 wdt:P921} } LIMIT 100
output: Disguising a Suicide as a Homicide: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Hans Gross, and "The Problem of Thor Bridge"
Medical writings of a literary physician, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle(1859-1930).
On Conan Doyle; or, The Whole Art of Storytelling

1.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
subjects that contain "canon" with incoming edges to Arthur Conan Doyle.
a piece of work ("canon of Sherlock Holmes") should be directly connected with it's author
1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?sub ?subName ?p ?name WHERE { ?sub ?p wd:Q35610 . ?p sc:name ?name. ?sub sc:name ?subName. FILTER(REGEX(?subName, "(?i)canon")) } LIMIT 200

2.narrative:
all properties of the canon of Sherlock Holmes
The only starting point I have to find the BGP for "film" is either Arthur Conan Doyle or the "canon of Sherlock Holmes"
2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q2316684 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20

2.narrative:
I know there are movies about Sherlock Holmes, so I look for
"derivative work" (wdt:P4969) of the "Canon of Sherlock Holmes"
2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20
output: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

2.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
What are the derivative works "instances of" (wdt:P31") ?
2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969/wdt:P31 ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20

3.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
Same query as the previous one.
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969/wdt:P31 ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20

4.narrative: Properties of films and tv series related to the canon of Sherlock Holmes
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?name. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 200
output: Box Office Mojo film ID (former scheme)
AFI Catalog of Feature Films ID
original language of film or TV show
BFI Films, TV and people ID

4.narrative:
Check objects with predicate publication date (wdt:P577). But publication date seems to never be used.
Actually, I am looking for objects that have a label, so excluding strings such as dates. That's why empty result set.
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { ?derivativeWork wdt:P577 ?obj. ?obj sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 2

4.narrative: Derivative work of the canon of Sherlock Holmes
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 20
output: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

4.narrative: Properties of Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q243643 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 2000
output: Box Office Mojo film ID (former scheme)
AFI Catalog of Feature Films ID
original language of film or TV show

4.narrative: Publication date of Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows. Empty (Again, I am excluding literals..)
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q243643 wdt:P577 ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 2000

4.narrative:
All literals of properties of Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows.
Only here I realize using "sc:name" automatically filters out all literals, because they don't have a label
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name ?obj WHERE { wd:Q243643 ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?name FILTER(isLiteral(?obj)) } LIMIT 200
output: Box Office Mojo film ID (former scheme)
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
AFI Catalog of Feature Films ID
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

4.narrative: publication years of films and tv series derivative from the "canon of Sherlock Holmes"
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName (year(?obj) as ?Year) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P577 ?obj. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 200
output: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

4.narrative:
publication year of films and tv series derivative from the "canon of Sherlock Holmes"
retrieving only the most recent year
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName (MIN(year(?obj)) as ?Year) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P577 ?obj. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 200
output: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

4.narrative:
Up to know I used "derivative Work" to get related works. I see if there are films or tv series with edges
incoming to the "canon of Sherlock Holmes".
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?video ?videoName ?p ?pName WHERE { ?video ?p wd:Q2316684. ?video wdt:P31 ?type. ?p sc:name ?pName. ?video sc:name ?videoName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 200
output: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

4.narrative:
Up to know I used "derivative Work" to get related works. I see if there are films or tv series with edges
incoming to the "canon of Sherlock Holmes" and their release year.
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?video ?videoName ?p ?pName (MIN(year(?publicationDate)) as ?Year) WHERE { ?video ?p wd:Q2316684. ?video wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P577 ?publicationDate. ?p sc:name ?pName. ?video sc:name ?videoName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 200
output: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

4.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
publication year of films and tv series related to the "canon of Sherlock Holmes"
retrieving only the most recent year
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT (?derivativeWork as ?relatedWork) (?derivativeWorkName as ?relatedWorkName) (MIN(year(?obj)) as ?Year) WHERE {{ wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P577 ?obj. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424}} UNION{ ?derivativeWork ?p wd:Q2316684. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P577 ?obj. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } } LIMIT 200
output: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

5.narrative:
Cast member (wdt:P161) found with CTRL+F in the notebook.
results seems to have only actors of the two major latest movies (the ones with Jude Law)..
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?castMember ?castMemberName (COUNT(DISTINCT ?derivativeWork) as ?film) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P161 ?castMember. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. ?castMember sc:name ?castMemberName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } GROUP BY ?castMember ?castMemberName HAVING (COUNT( DISTINCT ?derivativeWork) > 1)

5.narrative: looking if there are other ways to retrieve cast members, starting from "Sherlock" (wd:Q192837)
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?edge ?edgeName WHERE {{ wd:Q192837 ?edge ?object. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. FILTER (!isLiteral(?object)) }UNION{ ?subject ?edge wd:Q192837. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName } } LIMIT 200
output: original language of film or TV show

5.narrative:
looking if there are other ways to retrieve cast members, starting from "Sherlock"(wd:Q192837),
printing subjects and objects with some specific predicates
after reading the results it seems that actors are only retrieved with "cast mamber" (wdt:P161)
This is an inefficient query, because is checking the same edges to be either outgoing or incoming.
To make it more efficient I would need use the appropriate VALUES for incoming/outgoing edges
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?edge ?edgeName ?iri ?iriName WHERE {{ wd:Q192837 ?edge ?iri. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. VALUES ?edge {wdt:P161 wdt:P1881 wdt:P674 wdt:P179 wdt:P527} }UNION{ ?iri ?edge wd:Q192837. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. VALUES ?edge {wdt:P161 wdt:P1881 wdt:P674 wdt:P179 wdt:P527} } } LIMIT 200

5.narrative:
Same as before but trying to distinguish between incoming/outgoing edges.
It's longer to write
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?incomingEdge ?incomingEdgeName ?outgoingEdge ?outgoingEdgeName WHERE {{ wd:Q192837 ?outgoingEdge?object. ?outgoingEdge sc:name ?outgoingEdgeName. FILTER (!isLiteral(?object)) }UNION{ ?subject ?incomingEdge wd:Q192837. ?incomingEdge sc:name ?incomingEdgeName } } LIMIT 200
output: original language of film or TV show

5.narrative:
looking if there are other ways to retrieve cast members, starting from "Sherlock"(wd:Q192837),
printing subjects and objects with some specific predicates
after reading the results it seems that actors are only retrieved with "cast mamber" (wdt:P161)
Same as before, but differentiating between incoming/outgoing edges
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?edge ?edgeName ?iri ?iriName WHERE {{ wd:Q192837 ?edge ?iri. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. VALUES ?edge {wdt:P161 wdt:P1881 wdt:P674 wdt:P527} }UNION{ ?iri ?edge wd:Q192837. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. VALUES ?edge {wdt:P527} } } LIMIT 200

5.narrative: Including all derivative works, not only tv series and films. But, same result as before.
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?castMember ?castMemberName (COUNT(DISTINCT ?derivativeWork) as ?film) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P161 ?castMember. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. ?castMember sc:name ?castMemberName. } GROUP BY ?castMember ?castMemberName HAVING (COUNT( DISTINCT ?derivativeWork) > 1)

5.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
Same as the first query for this task but considering also films or tv series with edges
incoming to the "canon of Sherlock Holmes".
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?castMember ?castMemberName (COUNT(DISTINCT ?derivativeWork) as ?film) WHERE { { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P161 ?castMember. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. ?castMember sc:name ?castMemberName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424}} UNION { ?derivativeWork ?p wd:Q2316684. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P161 ?castMember. ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. ?castMember sc:name ?castMemberName. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } } GROUP BY ?castMember ?castMemberName HAVING (COUNT( DISTINCT ?derivativeWork) > 1)

6.narrative:
From Wikipedia: "presented in recognition of excellence in American primetime television programming".
with CTRL+F found "award received" (wdt:P166) in this notebook. (I was looking for "award", substring of the requested BGP)
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type; wdt:P166 ?obj. ?obj sc:name ?name. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} } LIMIT 200
output: Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Made for Television Movie
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Cinematography for a Miniseries or Movie
British Academy Television Award for Best Supporting Actor

TCA Award for Outstanding Achievement in Movies, Miniseries and Specials

Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Music Composition for a Miniseries, Movie, or a Special
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Single-Camera Picture Editing for a Limited Series or Movie
Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Movie/Miniseries
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Sound Editing for a Limited or Anthology Series, Movie or Special
Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Movie/Miniseries Actor

6.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
IRIs connected with Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Made for Television Movie
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?iri ?iriName WHERE {{ wd:Q7243506 ?edge ?iri. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. }UNION{ ?iri ?edge wd:Q7243506. ?iri sc:name ?iriName } } LIMIT 200

7.narrative:
Retrieving predicates between Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Made for Television Movie
and Primetime Emmy Award -> "instance of" (wdt:P31)
7.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?edge ?edgeName ?iri ?iriName WHERE {{ wd:Q7243506 ?edge ?iri. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. }UNION{ ?iri ?edge wd:Q7243506. ?iri sc:name ?iriName. ?edge sc:name ?edgeName. } } LIMIT 2

7.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
All instances of Primetime Emmy Award
7.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?award ?name WHERE { ?award wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. ?award sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 200
output: Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Unstructured Reality Program

8.narrative: Number of awards per derivative work
8.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName (COUNT(DISTINCT ?premio) as ?award) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} OPTIONAL{ ?derivativeWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. } GROUP BY ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName LIMIT 100
output: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

8.narrative: Including all derivative works, not only tv series and films. But, same result as before.
8.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName (COUNT( DISTINCT ?premio) as ?award) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. OPTIONAL{ ?derivativeWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. } GROUP BY ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName LIMIT 100
output: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

8.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName (COUNT( DISTINCT ?premio) as ?award) WHERE { wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?anotherWork wdt:P94 wd:Q2316684. OPTIONAL{ ?anotherWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } OPTIONAL{ ?derivativeWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. ?anotherWork sc:name ?anotherWorkName. } GROUP BY ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName LIMIT 100

8.narrative: Number of awards per derivative work. Not working because I am using wdt:P94 instead of wdt:P941.
8.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName (COUNT(DISTINCT ?premio) as ?award) WHERE {{ wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} OPTIONAL{ ?derivativeWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. }UNION { ?derivativeWork wdt:P94 wd:Q2316684 . ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} OPTIONAL{ ?derivativeWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. } } GROUP BY ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName LIMIT 100
output: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

8.narrative:
FINAL QUERY
Number of awards per related film and television series
8.query: SELECT DISTINCT (?derivativeWork as ?relatedWork) (?derivativeWorkName as ?relatedWorkName) (COUNT(DISTINCT ?premio) as ?award) WHERE {{ wd:Q2316684 wdt:P4969 ?derivativeWork. ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. }UNION { ?derivativeWork ?p wd:Q2316684 . ?derivativeWork wdt:P31 ?type. VALUES ?type {wd:Q5398426 wd:Q11424} ?derivativeWork sc:name ?derivativeWorkName. } OPTIONAL{ ?derivativeWork wdt:P166 ?premio. ?premio wdt:P31 wd:Q1044427. } } GROUP BY ?derivativeWork ?derivativeWorkName LIMIT 100
output: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
